Jackman does a water rescue

Actor Hugh Jackman rescued his children and other swimmers from a rip tide, a stretch of turbulent water in the sea, at Bondi Beach in Sydney on Saturday.

In a video obtained by a news channel, Jackman could be seen grabbing the arm of a man and pulling him around, as the man held onto the actor’s daughter, reports aceshowbiz.com.

Jackman then helped his son Oscar, 15, from the same rip. The Wolverine actor was also seen waving at other swimmers in a bid to attract their attention and get them to come ashore.

Lifesavers also launched into action, using boards and jet skis to make several other rescues.

Peter Adam, the man who was grabbed by the actor, told the news channel that he was helping the actor’s daughter at the time. “He wasn’t rescuing me, I was assisting him to get his daughter up to the sandbar. He then grabbed my hand to get us up. He then went to get his son,” Adam said. The North Bondi Surf Lifesaving Club took to Instagram to thank Jackman and the surf lifesavers. — IANS
title: Hugh Jackman rescues children from drowning
